question: 広告
partsOfSpeech: noun, する verb, の adjective
sourceMnemonic: When you <kanji>announce</kanji> something to a <kanji>wide</kanji> audience, you're just throwing your message out there for everyone to hear. This is just a big wide <vocabulary>advertisement</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Sorry, you only learned the kun'yomi reading with <ja>広</ja>. So, think of it this way when you need to remember this word's meaning: You're <vocabulary>advertising</vocabulary> something. It's a big advertisement to advertise how terrible a person <ja><reading>こう</reading>いち</ja> is. Come up with some terrible things he's done so that you can imagine this crazy Koichi advertisement you made and ran on national TV.
